summary.intent: Address PR review comments about inconsistent hash truncation usage in manual_commit_hooks.go
summary.outcome: Replaced all three instances of manual [:7] hash slicing with the truncateHash helper function for consistency

repo: truncateHash helper exists in manual_commit_hooks.go for consistent 7-character hash truncation
PR review requested consistency across entire file, not just changed lines

code.finding: PrepareCommitMsg was using raw newHead[:7] slice instead of truncateHash helper
updateBaseCommitIfChanged was using raw newHead[:7] slice instead of truncateHash helper
truncateHash helper function implementation uses [:7] internally - correctly excluded from refactoring

workflow: Used git amend to consolidate consistency fixes into the original commit rather than creating a new one
Expanded scope from PR diff to entire file when reviewer requested broader consistency

friction: Initially only fixed instances in PR diff, required second pass to fix pre-existing code
